description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on Jersey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 2-6 November
title_page: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 2-6 November - BBC News
maintext:
Summing up the briefing, Jersey's political and public health leaders have appealed for islanders' help in the fight against coronavirus.
Health Minister Richard Renouf called on people to follow health guidance to "keep us safe and avoid stricter measures".
Deputy medical officer of health Dr Ivan Muscat said: "Please help us help you by acting responsibly."
Chief Minister John Le Fondre added if islanders "work together" to protect the community and the "freedoms we've worked so hard to retain", then no more "draconian measures" would need to be introduced.
